thread.title: Steve Aoki jumps to Louis Tomlinson's defence following arrest over airport attack
thread.title_full: Steve Aoki jumps to Louis Tomlinson's defence following arrest over airport attack

author: Jennifer Crothers
title: Steve Aoki jumps to Louis Tomlinson's defence following arrest over airport attack
text:
Steve Aoki jumps to Louis Tomlinson's defence following arrest over airport attack The One Direction singer's collaborator and friend has spoken out in support of the star Share Steve Aoki has spoken out in defence of his pal Louis Tomlinson Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
DJ Steve Aoki has leapt to Louis Tomlinson's defence following his arrest after an airport brawl in Los Angeles on Saturday. 
Louis was arrested on Saturday following an altercation with a photographer at baggage reclaim, and Steve has spoken out in support of his friend and collaborator. 
“Wish the paparazzi respected personal space,” he tweeted. “U can still do your job without having to put your camera literally in someone’s face.” 
His words were retweeted over 37,000 times, and fans praised Steve speaking out, saying, "Thank you for standing up for him we’re beyond grateful," and countless exclamations of "Thank you Steve!" were tweeted. Steve spoke out about Louis' ordeal (Photo: Splash News) Steve tweeted his support for the star (Photo: Twitter) Louis and Steve on The X Factor after performing Just Hold On in December (Photo: ITV) Louis hugged his mate Steve after Just Hold On hit number one (Photo: Twitter/@steveaoki) 
Louis became in embroiled in an airport bust up after a photographer got too close to his face and other travellers turned on girlfriend Eleanor Calder, sources said. 
The new couple, who are believed to have rekindled their romance, were returning from Vegas after a week of partying on Friday evening when Louis was spotted by waiting paparazzi. 
Louis and Steve worked together on Louis' debut single Just Hold On, which hit number one on iTunes in over 36 countries in December. 
Louis was detained in a citizens arrest - sources confirmed - and has now be charged with battery - but not as a felony offence. The photographer was also arrested but it is not known whether they have been charged. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
